page.title: 08THE LAST STRAW
page.content: This building has had a number of uses.At one time it was the local police station but for the last thirty years it has been a cafe, restaurant and now a licensed house. Its name has also changed, from Sally Lunn's to Sarum Grill to the Last Straw. It is by this last name that it is now known.The change in use is the result of a change in peoples's eating habits as most people now wish to have a drink with their meal.The proprietor has catered for this. It is a very popular restaurant with people coming from a wide area. Meals are served at lunchtime as well as in the evening. The building is a well-known tourist attraction because of its thatched roof and oak beams, though part of the building is modern and was built to match in with the older part.
